page.title: 18The People of Lyndhurst
page.content: During our survey many inhabitants were interviewed giving us an insight into the history of the area, and the news and views of the people there today. Most people like living in the area because it is peaceful and close to the New Forest. One lady who lives in the cottage by Parkhill Hotel keeps cows, horses and chickens and grows her own vegetables. She has a car but rides her horse nearly everwhere; and like many other inhabitants, would like to see the area remain much the same as it is today. In the 15th century travellers used to stop at the Crown and Stirrup Public House for refreshments on their journeys. Tourists travel through Lyndhurst today and the summer traffic is of much concern there.
